page.title: 17TATHALL END
page.content: Tathall End is a quiet isolated village and does not have a church or even a pub.One of its main features is the stream or brook that flows into the river Ouse at Newport Pagnell.There have been little bridges built over the brook for access to houses on that side of the road.There are quite a few man made ponds to stop the fields from flooding.The livestock and wildlife in the fields include cows,sheep,horses and ducks.There are also fish,trees and hedgerows.To the nearest village with shops is exactly 1.4 miles but to the nearest shopping centre which is Milton Keynes, would be 6 miles.It would take 11 minutes to get there.There are two farms in the village and each own a lot of livestock.It is a little village with ten houses but we think its a great place to live. By JAMES DUCKETT and NIGEL GINGER.
